title: Niobrara National Scenic River: Park Home
body: Not Ordinary, Extraordinary  The Niobrara National Scenic River is not just the premier recreation river in Nebraska. It is a unique crossroads where many species of plants and animals coexist unlike anywhere else. High water quality and the relatively free-flowing nature of the Niobrara support diverse life while unique fossil-filled sandstone cliffs host over 200 waterfalls. Read More             Ranger-guided Canoe/Kayak Floats   Niobrara National Scenic River will partner with outfitters to offer several ranger-guided canoe floats this summer. Join the fun!            Fort Niobrara Ranger-guided Programs   Discover the wildlife along the Niobrara NSR with a park ranger at Fort Niobrara National Wildlife Refuge.        Junior Ranger Programs   Kids can join a park ranger at Smith Falls State Park for a hands-on program to discover some of the special things about the Niobrara NSR.        Kids' Activities   Kids are invited to the Visitor Center on Saturdays for crafts and hands-on activities that will help them discover the Niobrara NSR.
